text: A lot of rain during the 2023 East Asian rainy season caused very bad flooding and landslides across South Korea. This was mostly a problem for people in the provinces of North Chungcheong and North Gyeongsang. At least 44 people were killed, and six are missing. ==Impact== Many people were badly hurt when torrential rains caused landslides and the overflow of a dam in North Chungcheong. This caused the evacuation of over 9,200 homes and over 14,400 people across South Korea. On 17 July, the Yonhap News Agency reported that 628 public buildings and 317 private houses and businesses were damaged by the heavy rain. According to the Ministry of the Interior and Safety, over of farmland were damaged or flooded and 693,000 livestock were killed. Several cultural heritage sites were also damaged. These include Gongsanseong Fortress and Mungyeong Saejae. ==Government response== Prime Minister Han Duck-soo deployed the Republic of Korea Armed Forces. He made them do search and rescue operations because the flood caused problems for rail services in the area. ==References== Category:2023 disasters in Asia Category:June 2023 events Category:July 2023 events Category:Floods in Asia Category:2023 floods Category:2020s in South Korea Category:Disasters in South Korea
title: 2023 South Korea floods
